title: The Hundred cricket draft 2019 in full: Every player selected for next year's competition

British sporting history was made on Sunday as the nations first-ever athlete draft was held for new cricket format The Hundred .

Eight teams had their pick of 570 players ahead of the competitions inaugural season next year, with each side adding 12 players to their final 16.

Every franchise had the same budget of £960,000 to spend on their squads, with the top-ranked players given a minimum reserve price across several bands.

Two local icons had already been assigned to each side, with their reserve prices deducted from the overall pot, as well as an England international on a central red-ball contract who is financed separately.

A maximum of three overseas players is allowed on each team, with the likes of Australia duo Steve Smith and David Warner available for the highest reserve price of £125,000, while England's Liam Plunkett and Mark Wood were among the domestic players in the hat.

Here is how all the teams shape up after the draft...

(Image: PA)
